Key Match Events: The Yankees opened the final month of the regular season with an ugly, sloppy, unsightly loss to the Cardinals, 14-7.
The Yankees gave up a season-high 21 hits.
The Yankees came back to tie the game with three runs in the bottom of the fifth and two more in the sixth, but the effort was wasted thanks to a five-run seventh inning by the Cardinals.
The big blow was a two-out, three-run double by Lars Nootbaar off Tommy Kahnle.
Nestor Cortes was knocked around for five runs on nine hits in four innings.
Scott Effross, in his first appearance since 2022 Tommy John surgery, was awful in the fifth.
Jordan Walker hit a two-run homer off Scott Effross.
Anthony Volpe hit an RBI single during the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone said, 'Tough day for us. We know how important these games are, certainly. We had another opportunity to win a series that we weren’t able to finish and that sucks. We’ve got to play our best.'
Juan Soto said, 'This is the right time to get hot. We’re definitely trying.'
Nestor Cortes said, 'As bad as people think we’re playing and as bad as it might show we’re playing, we’re still in first place. It goes to show it’s there for us to take.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured bad starting pitching by Nestor Cortes, a terrible showing from the bullpen, and some shaky defense — especially by Juan Soto.
The Yankees dropped a second straight series to a National League team that’s barely in playoff contention.
The skies opened briefly in the top of the fourth inning, affecting play conditions.
